In Julia, Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

Here's a Julia function called `pig_latinify` that uses multi-threading to translate a vector of strings into pig latin. Note that this implementation assumes that the length of the input vector is equal to the number of threads in the system. If the number of threads is less than the length of the input vector, the function will only use as many threads as there are available.

```julia
using Base.Threads

function pig_latinify(strings::Vector{String})
    output = similar(strings)

    @threads for i in 1:length(strings)
        word = strings[i]
        if isascii(word) && all(isletter, word)
            first_char = word[1]
            rest = word[2:end]
            pig_latin_word = isempty(rest)? "$first_charay" : "$rest-$first_charay"
            output[i] = pig_latin_word
        else
            output[i] = word
        end
    end
